intro: Anemonastrum deltoideum, commonly known as the delta thistle, is a perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the western United States. It is characterized by its robust, spiny stems and large, deltoid-shaped leaves that are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces showy purple to pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and dry fields. Its botanical features make it well adapted to harsh, dry environments.
